DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this pilot study is to test the feasibility of an innovative, couples based approach to weight management during pregnancy. The primary hypothesis is that a couples-based behavioral weight management program will reduce the rate of gestational weight gain compared to standard care.
DOC.brief_title: Partners in Health: A Couples-based Approach to Obesity Prevention
DOC.criteria: Pregnant Women >18 years old 1522 weeks gestation BMI >= 25 cohabitating with partner for at least 3 months or recently married willing to consent Nonpregnant Partner BMI >= 25 cohabitating with partner for at least 3 months or recently married willing to consent Untreated medical or psychological problem Inability to be physically active
